title: @Riot - A small Syndra QoL change I've been asking for since season 3. PLEASE consider this
body:
Please make her Q with smartcasting behave like Ziggs Q.

When your cursor is outside of her Q range, make her cast it at max range in the direction of the cursor.

Right now if your cursor is outside of range and you hit Q, she will walk until she is in range to cast it. This makes it really frustrating to pull off a fast max-range Q-E. I can't count the amount of times I attempt Q-E at max range only to throw out only my E because my cursor was slightly out of range. And this still happens even with my 300+ games as Syndra.

And no, I don't want to use smart-cast indicators. Turning that option on adds more delay to abilities, and I'd rather not have more delay when I already play at 90-110 ping.

PLEASE upvote and get this seen. I've been wanting this forever.


(Also pls unnerf her Q it hits like a wet noodle at ranks 1-2 now)

replies.body:
I'd have to ask Meddler about this (he's the guy that made Syndra and knows the most about her), but there's probably a reason we do this. A year or so back when we were updating Karthus, I suggested that we give his Q this same treatment, and the responses internally were pretty resoundingly that it wouldn't be a good idea, namely because it would come at precision costs to the spell.

Any other Syndra players/mains have an opinion on this? See below for the exact suggestion (or read OP's post).

> When your cursor is outside of her Q range, make her cast it at max range in the direction of the cursor.

Syndra's Q doesn't require the precision that Karthus' Q does, and Syndra's other abilities are reliant on having Q out, so having a Q come out when you want it to is often more important than actually landing the Q itself.
If you're not trying to land Q on someone and instead just want it out then why not just cast it next to her?

> [{quoted}](name=exe3,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fT2jJwaE,comment-id=000000040000,timestamp=2015-08-17T12:40:36.722+0000)
>
> If you're not trying to land Q on someone and instead just want it out then why not just cast it next to her?

Because the closer to yourself you cast it, the longer it has to travel to get to max range. The longer it takes to make it to max range, the more time the enemy has to dodge it. It's also easier to aim at a far target the further you place the orb. Small positional differences make a bigger impact on where the orb will go the closer the orb is to Syndra, and since her E nerf you can't risk that since it is way more easy to miss.

Know what would be easier? To have my cursor on the enemy I'm aiming at, and being able to hit Q-E and having a guarantee that my stun will go perfectly where my cursor is aimed at, and that it will get there as fast as possible.

I don't want to try to work out where to put my Q at 3/4 range in order to hit where I want it to go. And no, I also don't want to give the enemy extra reaction time to avoid my stun. Even if you think its negligible, it is a difference that will eventually end up costing you a stun.

And i'd like my Q to land where my cursor is aiming at and be guaranteed that it won't land anywhere else. The problem is that you're treating Q and E as a single spell when they're not, they're completely separate spells that have an interesting and unique interaction but are still separate all the same and as such they need to be functional when used individually first and foremost.
it's far easier to aim your stun if your curser is close to your target

> Any other Syndra players/mains have an opinion on this? See below for the exact suggestion (or read OP's post).

Is there any chance you could make this an option like smartcast that the individual player can turn on and off?

There are a lot of abilities, like Syndra's Q, where both targeting types are extremely useful in some circumstances. Anivia's ult, for example. You want to place it precisely sometimes, but a lot of other times you just want to drop it at max range to EQ someone and end up walking because you're slightly out of max range. Having a game option to toggle it or a hotkey to toggle it would be *incredibly* nice.

Assuming that her E actually hits at max range, which some have seen not work at times, it would definitely help in clutch moments. Also it will most likely help increase the accuracy of the Q-E combo because in short, when you do the combo it feels like a linear skill shot in the direction of your cursor. So in retrospect using the combo while your cursor is  out of spell range would be helpful, since it would be hovering over the enemy champ.

I think it would be better if you could make a new casting option that let's you cast spells at max range than making your champ move in order to do it. Prime example is {{champion:9}} Crowstorm, in which many mains have screamed for this feature. I think making a new casting feature as an add on to smart cast would be nice.

Edit: I do prefer accuracy over anything however, which is why this option should be implemented rather than made for specific champion spells.

I agree. I've tried to pull off so many Q+E combos while kiting but ended up running towards the enemy cause of my pointer range. Very frustrating.

If you're going to take the time to speak to him, please bring up the fact that her ult is still bugged and has been since the patch Quinn was released. I reported it on the PBE, I reported it again when the Quinn patch hit live. Ignored. I reported it again not too long ago when they mentioned they'd be fixing some Syndra bugs. Still nothing.

Here we are an eternity later, and I still have my screen bug out and shake 50% of the time after casting Syndra's ult. Her model starts stuttering and the view I have is the screen shaking. Yes the frequency of this bug is literally 50% of casts. It lasts anywhere from 3 to 6+ seconds, and the shake/stutter used to be so bad that it was basically disabling you for that duration since you couldn't see shit. Now it's just super annoying.

I'm on a completely different set of hardware/software since that time, a new computer entirely, a new OS (Win 10 from 7), same bug as that different era in time.

I would much prefer to keep Syndra Q as is. It isn't a skillshot like Ziggs Q. While some don't care about the precision of the spell, others like myself do and it would be a huge usability hit if it just casted at max range instead of having Syndra walk into range so it'll land precisely where I wanted it to go in the first place. It's a huge reason I don't play Azir to be quite honest. Having soldiers spawn at max range instead of Azir walking forward to cast where I wanted them to spawn was incredibly frustrating, especially when I was auto-attacking a tower and then cast W on it only for a soldier to spawn instead because apparently I was a centimeter too far away, so annoying (tbh if you could change Azir W so that it functions like Syndra's Q I would be very happy and would give him another go ^_^ ).

Also correct me if i'm wrong but doesn't a Q->E combo send the orb to the same max distance regardless of how close it is to Syndra thus making the main reason the OP gave for this change redundant?

Not necessarily. I know I often find myself trying to stun someone by placing my mouse over them and pressing Q-E, but since my mouse is barely outside the Q range, only my E will fire. Having to aim in front of your intended target to hit what is really just an unusual skillshot just makes it more difficult. I know what the range of my stun is, let me try to use it that way.

I've done that too on occasion but I chalk that up to me failing to cast correctly rather than the spell having a problem because really I *did* cast it incorrectly by trying to cast it beyond its max range. You're treating Q-E as a single spell when they're two separate spells that interact with each other. This change might help some people with the stun combo but in return will seriously harm the usability of Q itself (something alone I am completely against) for something that isn't even necessary in the first place given you don't have to Q at max range for the stun combo.

How does making the Q cast at max range if you cast it outside of it's range harm the usability of Q at all? Please explain that to  me because I've heard it multiple times but never with an explanation.

Because it's losing precision. If I cast at a location I want the ball to land there, not anywhere else. The usability issue is that if i'm not in range the spell is no longer doing what I want anymore, it's casting the spell but not as I intended and putting the ball in a location I did not want.

There's also the case that I often use the current functionality as a sort of attack move. eg: enemy is running from me so I cast Q where they're heading to try and hit them with it, if that location is out of range Syndra will continue to move towards the enemy while I continually recast towards the enemies new location until I properly get in range and it is cast. With this new system I will have to move towards them during the chase and hope/guess when i'm in range before I cast Q otherwise it will just sloppily cast at max range and probably miss the target completely.

The issue I see is that proponents of this change are only thinking of the Q->E combo and not of Q as an individual spell. This type of change is fine and needed for skillshots like Ziggs Q and Javelin, etc... but the fact is that Q->E is not the spell, Q AND E are the spells and their usability should not be compromised to make their interaction a little better for certain players.

That argument doesn't make any sense to me. I can't think of a single situation on a single champion where I wouldn't want the skillshot to be cast anyway even if my mouse isn't at the correct range. Not letting me cast it outside it's range does nothing but take control away from me and it frustrates the hell out of me whenever it happens. Let me miss my skillshot if I don't know my range, even if it's a ground targeted skillshot and not a linear shillshot. I don't want the game to move me into range if I'm not already; that's more likely to get me killed than it is to help.

Ziggs Q used to be frustrating to me too, other champs like Rivens R did the same for a long time, it was was rage inducing, I luckily was able to even get the designer of Heimers rework (well the guy who ended up tidying it up and releasing it) to change his ulti grenade to cast without him walking into range but the problem is that these are all individual spells, not spell combos. Yes if you only want to spam Q/E as if it was a single spell this change would make heaps of sense but as i've said time and time again they are not a single spell, they are two separate spells that interact, and it's far more important that they be functional individually than in combination (though that implies Q->E isn't functional as is which is far from true).

You still haven't really explained to me how keeping it the way it is improves Q's functionality and precision. The only argument I can imagine for keeping it the way it is, is if you regularly try to cast it from too far away and let the game move Syndra close enough to cast. That sounds like a very dangerous and sloppy way to cast the spell, and like I said before, likely you get you killed. Having the game move you into range in order to cast your spell does technically increase the precision of the spell, but it also decreases your precision at controlling your own champion, as well as decreasing both the precision and fluidity of her Q->E combo. Yes, the Q->E is technically 2 skills but in game, it essentially functions as a linear skillshot, one made harder to hit by Q's archaic casting system.

I've explained it, multiple times already, I want the spell to go where my cursor is positioned, it's logical, it's intuitive, it's what I want, i'm not repeating myself again.

Any change will have minimal impact for most players given the core issue is that people are failing their casts, not that the current cast paradigm is bad.

Also stop using archaic incorrectly, you're just using the word to try and make your argument carry more weight.

If Riot has changed other spells to no longer work like this, it is by definition archaic if it remains the way it is. Given how utterly reliant Syndra is on landing her stun, making it more difficult to use because of the limitation on Q makes Syndra needlessly hard to play and reduces her playmaking potential since you can't cast the stun as accurately or quickly. All for a mechanic that for me and lots of other people in this thread, gives no benefit at best and is actively harmful at worst. I'm not the only one complaining about the spell moving you when I don't want it to, and I'm not the only one complaining that it makes the stun harder and slower to use. And all for a function, moving into range if I'm not already in range, that I never even use. I think archaic is the perfect word to describe such a mechanic. At the very least, Riot should just us a smart cast option to to deal with this kind of situation.
Syndra's Q-E combo is for all intents and purposes a linear skillshot just like Jarvan's E-Q, and I see no reason why they should not function the same.

They've changed it for linear skillshots, Q is not a linear skillshot so it's not applicable. Furthermore to call something archaic means that it is old and outdated and no longer has any use in any circumstance, no exceptions. But the truth is that this is just one way for a spell to cast, one that favors precision, which Q needs imo.
